title: Email not being marked as read after being opened and read
content: I will receive an email in my Inbox and open it to read. When I close and exit the email, it will stay bolded in the Inbox, as if it's a new email that hasn't been read yet. The only way to get it to "un-bold" to show it's been read already, is to right click on it and select "mark as read". Is there a setting I am missing to show opened emails as read?

title: Despite setting the delete emails after 30 days in Local Folders - Disk Space it's not deleting them
content:
Hi,

I want to delete the amount of emails the Thunderbird stores on my local computer.

I do not want the email on the server deleted.

I went to settings, local folders, disk space and chose the option for Delete messages more than 30 days old.

I made the change and ran compact.

It's not deleting the emails at all.

Why not ?

Again, I do not want to delete the emails anywhere else (on the server), so making the change under the folder or my account is not it.

Anyone able to point me to where the problem is and why the emails are not being deleted from my local disk ?

Mike

title: Saving an edited draft in Draft subfolder?
content:
Hi,

When saving an edited message in Drafts, the original message gets overwritten/replaced by the new one. That's fine.

But when saving an edited message in Drafts subfolder (Drafts/ProjectX), a new message is created directly in Drafts and the original message stays in the subfolder. Please is there a way for saving messages in Drafts subfolders to behave the same way as saving messages in the Drafs folder, i.e. overwriting/replacing the original message wherever it is located.

Thanks a lot,

Pavel.
creator: pavhofman

Dear Sir,

title: A parasitic additional address to every outlook email
content: I have an outlook email on my Windows PC, via Thunderbird. For a long time each email I send has been joined by and unknown and unwanted additional address ' sophieprimaryworld@gmail.com ' with an always full inbox. This address appeared in my contacts list (unkown to me) and was deleted, but still attaches, seemingly both in inward and outward directions. The result often is a letter - 'tried to contact you without success' even though I get the incoming item. More recently by outlook account is password barred on my PC but now my android mobile also generates 'undeliverable messages. I would be obliged for help to remove tha anonymous Sophie from my system. Thanks to anyone in anticipation

title: Where is the Delete message from server in Message Filters?
content: I'm recovering from a computer disaster and thus have a fresh install of Thunderbird without any of my old emails or message filters. Previously, when creating filter rules for junk emails, I used the option to create an action rule to delete the message from the server. The sequence was "Set Junk Status to: Junk" > "Delete Message From Server" > "Delete Message." This way I didn't have to manage the emails on the server. I want to continue this, but I don't find the Delete Message from Server option any longer. After reading other articles saying IMAP was a prerequisite for this action rule, I tried to set up a second account using IMAP but TBird told me the existing account was already set to IMAP for incoming mail. Confusing. But the bottom line is I need to know how to access this action rule going forward.
creator: Hanasazi

title: Thundermail feature request: imap client
content:
I'm quite excited about Thundermail, so I would like to already post a feature request that would be essencial for me: an imap client.

I'll use my example for motivation. I have three email accounts:

- Personal: GMAIL (I'll consider tb.pro once it's available as a replacement). - Professional / Institutional: OUTLOOK (unfortunately... it's horrible to use!) - For website logins and to concentrate spams: YAHOO

I would love to have all those three accounts on a single email client on the web. I don't like to use dedicated apps for clients (like Thunderbird) due to the simplicity of having it all on a web client (like GMAIL and OUTLOOK web).

On GMAIL I can 'gmailify' the YAHOO account, but it does not work with my OUTLOOK and the gmailily feature is somehow restricted for a single account. I could try to add the OUTLOOK account on GMAIL via POP, but I want IMAP and GMAIL only allow for POP.

So, the feature request would be for ThunderMail to act not only as an email server/client as GMAIL, but also as a full email client with IMAP/POP, with special attention to the IMAP case which would take ThunderMail truly beyond GMAIL.
creator: gersonjferreira
